channel.title: Player Update packet
channel.description: I have been fooling around with the old 317 client (mopar's refactor) and, mainly speaking, my few hours dealing with the player update packet have only been half successful. I should have mostly completed updating when it comes to walking as well as other player updating. However, the actual player update block is the part I am having troubles with. I looked at the client and saw that a 0 tells the client to not update that player, but I did that and it still continued to update. In actuality, it is trying to do the chat update (so it throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in the stream class). Even if I don't write the byte, it still does that. Has anyone else had these problems with that pesky packet as well?

item.title: Player Update packet
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

moparisthebest also failed to refactor the stream class correctly, like writeByte is writeWordBigEndian (what the fuck?).

Could be that you are mixing up your packet structure.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Update packet
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I have been fooling around with the old 317 client (mopar’s refactor) and, mainly speaking, my few hours dealing with the player update packet have only been half successful. I should have mostly completed updating when it comes to walking as well as other player updating. However, the actual player update block is the part I am having troubles with. I looked at the client and saw that a 0 tells the client to not update that player, but I did that and it still continued to update. In actuality, it is trying to do the chat update (so it throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in the stream class). Even if I don’t write the byte, it still does that. Has anyone else had these problems with that pesky packet as well?
